message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.MM. 

The paper focuses on producing visual explanations for decisions made by deep neural networks, specifically Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), in the context of image classification, image captioning, and visual question answering. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of gradient-based techniques to produce these visual explanations, which falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the robustness of the visualizations to adversarial perturbations, which is a topic in the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Furthermore, the paper discusses the use of textual explanations for model decisions, which falls under the sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the paper provides a demo on CloudCV, which is a platform for mobile cloud visual media computing, falling under the sub-category of cs.MM (Multimedia).
